DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Distant Tissue Surgery Site Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The removal, biopsy or aspiration of regional lymph node(s) at the time of surgery of the primary site or during a separate surgical event at all facilities.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment First Course Distant Tissue Surgery
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The removal, biopsy or aspiration of regional lymph node(s) at the time of surgery of the primary site or during a separate surgical event at all facilities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: Far apart in space, time, or relevance from a point of reference.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.

Concepts.definition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities._Position in relation to the surroundings._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. [Explanatory Comment: Select appropriate code from either of the two attached reference documents.]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Position in relation to the surroundings.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
A position in relation to its surroundings.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR, V 11.1 Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: RX Summ--Scope Req 98-02
ReferenceDocuments.description: This field is to be used for ROADS codes after the ROADS to FORDS conversion. It is also to be used to code Scope of Regional Lymph Node Surgery at all facilities for all tumors diagnosed before January 1, 2003.
